snippet: Republicans have proved less receptive to some business groups’ aims and a crucial Apple supplier pledged to improve its factories’ conditions.

headline.main: The Week’s Business News in Pictures

snippet: Despite weathering criticism from workers’ advocates throughout the years, the Fair Labor Association received favorable reviews for its toughness on Foxconn.
abstract: Fair Labor Association receives wide praise for its tough evaluation of conditions at the Chinese electronics manufacturing giant Foxconn; evaluation, which uncovered several problems and improprieties, was conducted at Apple's behest.

headline.main: Labor Audit on Foxconn Is Thorough, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Labor Audit On Foxconn Is Thorough, Experts Say

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

snippet: A shortage of workers is a big factor in the long shifts and workweeks that manufacturers have used to meet production quotas, all while forcing higher wages.
abstract: News analysis; Apple, attempting to improve working conditions at its Foxconn factory in China, may have trouble finding a sufficient number of blue collar workers who are willing to work a curtailed number of hours; Foxconn's notoriously long shifts and workweeks were instituted in part because of labor shortages that have become common in Chinese factories and while better conditions are important, adapting Chinese workplaces to American standards is an evolutionary process that is likely to take considerable time.

headline.main: Two Sides to Labor in China
headline.print_headline: Two Sides To Labor In China

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a lawsuit against Apple over its Siri ads, and engines from moon rockets used in the Apollo program found in the...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a lawsuit against Apple over its Siri ads, and engines from moon rockets used in the Apollo program found in the ocean.

snippet: Using Foursquare to scan for women in the area without their knowledge, users can see their full name, profile photo and send a message by logging onto their Facebook account.
